page.topic: How to Base a Chart on Cross-sectional Data
page.description: When a data series must be based on multiple fields in a record rather than a single field across multiple records, a Cross-Sectional data series can be created to map multiple columns in a table to one or more sub-series.

discussion.p: A Cross-Sectional data series specifies a mapping between columns in a table and one or more sub-series. This is useful when series data spans multiple columns instead of multiple rows. EG, a table that stores quarterly sales data for two years in a single record.

Cross-Section data series can be created for SQL or DBF databases. The *[ui:Data extraction template]* defines how to map each row of data from the table into one or more subseries in the data series definition.

section.description: To create a Cross-Section data series, follow the steps below:

step.description: In the *[ui:UX Builder]* Properties, open the Data Series builder by clicking the [...] button for the *[ui:Data series]* property.
Create a new Data Series or Edit an Existing one.
Choose the "CrossSection" data series for your database. The cross-sectional data series available are described below:

item.name: SQL-CrossSection
item.description: Create a Cross-Sectional data series for a query against a SQL Database.

item.name: DBF-CrossSection
item.description: Create a Cross-Sectional data series for data from one or more DBF tables.

step.description: Define the data query to extract the data from the database. Your query can use arguments to filter the results. Specify an order clause to sort the results.

Define the *[ui:Data extraction template]* for the data series. The extraction template can define multiple sub-series. For example, the Data extraction template below defines a mapping of a table row that holds quarterly sales information for the current year and previous year into three subseries: 'Quarter', 'Sales', and 'SalesPrevious'.
